main event: A bright light was observed in the sky near Farewell, Alaska on January 11, 1959.
interesting points: The object was initially stationary and then moved to the north-west before disappearing,The sighting lasted for one hour,The light varied in color from reddish to bright white,It was compared in size to the brightest star visible in the night sky,Multiple potential explanations for the object included British balloon, satellite, and space debris.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
witness description: Observers described erratic and rapid movements of the light, including lazy-eights and circles.
